original: Dīgha Nikāya 5
analyzed: dīgha nikāya
translated: Long Discourses

original: Kūṭadantasutta
analyzed: kūṭadantasutta
translated: With Kūṭadanta

original: 1. Khāṇumatakabrāhmaṇagahapatikā
analyzed: khāṇumataka brāhmaṇa gahapatikā
translated: The Brahmins and householders of Khāṇumata

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā magadhesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi yena khāṇumataṁ nāma magadhānaṁ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā magadhesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi yena khāṇumatam nāma magadhānam brāhmaṇagāmaḥ tat avasari
translated: Once the Buddha was wandering in the Magadhan country with a large community of monks, with about five hundred monks. He arrived at a Magadhan Brahmin village called Khāṇumata.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā khāṇumate viharati ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā khāṇumate viharati ambalaṭṭhikāya
translated: There he stayed in the Ambalaṭṭhikā forest grove.

original: Tena kho pana samayena kūṭadanto brāhmaṇo khāṇumataṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ khāṇumatam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodaka
translated: At that time the Brahmin Kūṭadanta was living in Khāṇumata. It was a wealthy town, with abundant food and grass,

original: sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: sa dhaññam rāja bhoggam raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnam rāja dāyam brahma deyya
translated: given by King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha as a royal gift and grant, with full royal powers,

original: Tena kho pana samayena kūṭadantassa brāhmaṇassa mahāyañño upakkhaṭo hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena kūṭadantassa brāhmaṇassa mahā yaññaḥ upakkhaṭaḥ hoti
translated: At that time Kūṭadanta was preparing for a great sacrifice.

original: Satta ca usabhasatāni satta ca vacchatarasatāni satta ca vacchatarīsatāni satta ca ajasatāni satta ca urabbhasatāni thūṇūpanītāni honti yaññatthāya.
analyzed: satta ca usabha satāni satta ca vacchatara satāni satta ca vacchatarī satāni satta ca aja satāni satta ca urabbha satāni thūṇu upanītāni honti yaññatthāya
translated: Seven hundred bulls, seven hundred bullocks, seven hundred heifers, seven hundred he-goats, and seven hundred rams were tethered there, ready for sacrifice.

original: Assosuṁ kho khāṇumatakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā:
analyzed: kho khāṇumatakāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikā
translated: The brahmin householders of Khanumata heard

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito magadhesu cārikaṁ caramāno
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ magadhesu cārikam caramānaḥ
translated: that the ascetic Gotama, the son of the Sakyans who had gone forth from the Sakyan clan,🔽had arrived at Khanumata and was staying by the Gaggara lotus pond.

original: mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi khāṇumataṁ anuppatto khāṇumate
analyzed: mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi khāṇumatam an uppattaḥ khāṇumate
translated: They heard that:🔽‘The Blessed One is living at Khanumata,

original: viharati ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ.
analyzed: viharati ambalaṭṭhikāya
translated: in the Gaggara lotus pond.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: And of that Master Gotama this fine reputation has spread:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: “He is a Buddha, perfected and fully awakened, complete in insight and conduct, happy, knower of the world, supreme leader of trainable people, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a Buddha.

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He has realized this world—with its devas, Māras, & Brahmās, this population with its contemplatives & brahmans, its royalty & common people—and having realized it, teaches it to others.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and he reveals a holy life that’s utterly perfect and pure.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It’s good to see such arahants.”

original: Atha kho khāṇumatakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā khāṇumatā nikkhamitvā saṅghasaṅghī gaṇībhūtā yena ambalaṭṭhikā tenupasaṅkamanti.🔽Tena kho pana samayena kūṭadanto brāhmaṇo uparipāsāde divāseyyaṁ upagato hoti.
analyzed: atha kho khāṇumatakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā khāṇumatā nikkhamitvā saṅgha saṅghī gaṇībhūtā yena ambalaṭṭhikā tena upasaṅkamanti  tena khalu pana samayena kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ upari pāsāde divāseyyam upagataḥ hoti
translated: Then the brahmin householders of Khāṇumata, having left Khāṇumata, went to Ambalaṭṭhikā in a group, in a crowd.🔽Just then, the brahmin Kūṭadanta had gone up to the terrace on top of his stilt house for his midday nap.

original: Addasā kho kūṭadanto brāhmaṇo khāṇumatake brāhmaṇagahapatike khāṇumatā nikkhamitvā saṅghasaṅghī gaṇībhūte yena ambalaṭṭhikā tenupasaṅkamante.
analyzed: addasā kho kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ khāṇumatake brāhmaṇa gahapatike khāṇumatā nikkhamitvā saṅgha saṅghī gaṇībhūte yena ambalaṭṭhikā tena upasaṅkamante
translated: He saw the brahmin householders of Khāṇumata leaving Khāṇumata and going to Ambalaṭṭhikā in a group, in a crowd.

original: Disvā khattaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: disvā khattam āmantesi
translated: On seeing them, he addressed his charioteer, saying,

original: “kiṁ nu kho, bho khatte, khāṇumatakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā khāṇumatā nikkhamitvā saṅghasaṅghī gaṇībhūtā yena ambalaṭṭhikā tenupasaṅkamantī”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho bho khatte khāṇumatakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā khāṇumatā nikkhamitvā saṅgha saṅghī gaṇībhūtā yena ambalaṭṭhikā tena upasaṅkamanti iti
translated: “Why are the brahmin householders of Khāṇumata going to Ambalaṭṭhikā?”

original: “Atthi kho, bho, samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito magadhesu cārikaṁ caramāno🔽mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi khāṇumataṁ anuppatto, khāṇumate
analyzed: atthi kho bho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ magadhesu cārikam caramānaḥ  mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi khāṇumatam an uppattaḥ khāṇumate
translated: “There is a Sakyan named Gotama who went forth from a Sakyan family.🔽He has arrived at Khāṇumata

original: viharati ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ.
analyzed: viharati ambalaṭṭhikāya
translated: and is staying in Ambalaṭṭhikā together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred monks.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: He has this good reputation:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘He is the Blessed One, perfected and fully awakened, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, happy, knower of the world, supreme leader of trainable people, teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One.’

original: Tamete bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamantī”ti.
analyzed: tam ete bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamanti iti
translated: They are going to see him.”

original: Atha kho kūṭadantassa brāhmaṇassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho kūṭadantassa brāhmaṇassa etat ahosi
translated: Then the brahmin Kūṭadanta thought:

original: “sutaṁ kho pana metaṁ:
analyzed: sutam khalu pana mā ita
translated: “I have heard this:

original: ‘samaṇo gotamo tividhaṁ yaññasampadaṁ soḷasaparikkhāraṁ jānātī’ti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tividham yañña sampadam soḷasa parikkhāram jānāti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama knows about the triple arrangement of a sacrifice with its sixteen branches.’

original: Na kho panāhaṁ jānāmi tividhaṁ yaññasampadaṁ soḷasaparikkhāraṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana aham jānāmi tividham yañña sampadam soḷasa parikkhāra
translated: But I don’t know about the triple arrangement of a sacrifice with its sixteen branches.

original: Icchāmi cāhaṁ mahāyaññaṁ yajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmi ca aham mahāyaññam yajitu
translated: I want to perform a great sacrifice.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ upasaṅkamitvā tividhaṁ yaññasampadaṁ soḷasaparikkhāraṁ puccheyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham samaṇam gotamam upasaṅkamitvā tividham yañña sampadam soḷasa parikkhāram puccheyyanti
translated: Why don’t I go to the Buddha and ask him about the triple arrangement of a sacrifice with its sixteen branches?”

original: Atha kho kūṭadanto brāhmaṇo khattaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ khattam āmantesi
translated: He then addressed his steward,

original: “tena hi, bho khatte, yena khāṇumatakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā tenupasaṅkama. upasaṅkamitvā khāṇumatake brāhmaṇagahapatike evaṁ vadehi:
analyzed: tena hi bho khatte yena khāṇumatakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā khāṇumatake brāhmaṇa gahapatike evam vadehi
translated: “Well then, steward, go to the brahmins and householders of Khāṇumata and say to them:

original: ‘kūṭadanto, bho, brāhmaṇo evamāha—
analyzed: kūṭadantaḥ bho brāhmaṇaḥ evam āha
translated: ‘The brahmin Kūṭadanta says this:

original: āgamentu kira bhavanto, kūṭadantopi brāhmaṇo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī’”ti.
analyzed: āgamentu kira bhavantaḥ kūṭadantaḥ api brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: Please come, sirs, for I will go to see the ascetic Gotama.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho so khattā kūṭadantassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena khāṇumatakā brāhmaṇagahapatikā tenupasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā khāṇumatake brāhmaṇagahapatike etadavoca:
analyzed: eva bhoti kho saḥ khattā kūṭadantassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena khāṇumatakā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā khāṇumatake brāhmaṇa gahapatike etat avoca
translated: “Yes, sir,” he replied, and he went to the brahmin householders of Khāṇumata and told them:

original: “kūṭadanto, bho, brāhmaṇo evamāha:
analyzed: kūṭadantaḥ bho brāhmaṇaḥ evam āha
translated: “The brahmin Kūṭadanta says this:

original: ‘āgamentu kira bhonto, kūṭadantopi brāhmaṇo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī’”ti.
analyzed: āgamentu kira bhontaḥ kūṭadantaḥ api brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: ‘Please come, sirs, the brahmin Kūṭadanta will go to see the recluse Gotama.’”

original: 2. Kūṭadantaguṇakathā
analyzed: kūṭa danta guṇa kathā
translated: The Discussion of Kūṭadanta’s Qualities

original: Tena kho pana samayena anekāni brāhmaṇasatāni khāṇumate paṭivasanti:
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena anekāni brāhmaṇa satāni khāṇumate paṭivasanti
translated: Now on that occasion many hundreds of brahmins were staying in Khāṇumata

original: “kūṭadantassa brāhmaṇassa mahāyaññaṁ anubhavissāmā”ti.
analyzed: kūṭadantassa brāhmaṇassa mahā yaññam anubhavissāma ati
translated: thinking: “We will attend on the great sacrifice of the brahmin Kūṭadanta.”

original: Assosuṁ kho te brāhmaṇā:
analyzed: assosum kho te brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: They heard that

original: “kūṭadanto kira brāhmaṇo samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī”ti.
analyzed: kūṭa dantaḥ kira brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: “the brahmin Kūṭadanta is going to see the recluse Gotama.”

original: Atha kho te brāhmaṇā yena kūṭadanto brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkamiṁsu. upasaṅkamitvā kūṭadantaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha khalu te brāhmaṇāḥ yena kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tena upasaṅkamiṣu upasaṅkamitvā kūṭadantam brāhmaṇam etat avocuḥ
translated: Then they went to the brahmin Kūṭadanta and said to him:

original: “saccaṁ kira bhavaṁ kūṭadanto samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissatī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhavam kūṭadanto samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati iti
translated: “Is it true, sir, that you’re going to see the ascetic Gotama?”🔽“That’s true.”

original: “Evaṁ kho me, bho, hoti:
analyzed: evam khalu me bho hoti
translated: “But I think like this:

original: ‘ahampi samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissāmī’”ti.🔽“Mā bhavaṁ kūṭadanto samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkami.
analyzed: aham pi samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissāmi iti  mā bhavam kūṭa dantaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkami
translated: I should go to see the ascetic Gotama.”🔽“Don’t go to see the ascetic Gotama.

original: Na arahati bhavaṁ kūṭadanto samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.🔽Sace bhavaṁ kūṭadanto samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissati, bhoto kūṭadantassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati.
analyzed: na arahati bhavam kūṭadantaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu  sace bhavam kūṭadantaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissati bhoto kūṭadantassa yasaḥ hāyissati samaṇassa gotamassa yasaḥ abhivaḍḍhissati
translated: It’s not appropriate for you to go to see the ascetic Gotama.🔽If you go to see the ascetic Gotama, your fame will decrease and his will increase.

original: Yampi bhoto kūṭadantassa yaso hāyissati, samaṇassa gotamassa yaso abhivaḍḍhissati, imināpaṅgena na arahati bhavaṁ kūṭadanto samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: yam pi bhoto kūṭadantassa yasaḥ hāyissati samaṇassa gotamassa yasaḥ abhivaḍḍhissati iminā apaṅgena na arahati bhavam kūṭadantaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: And since your fame will decrease and his will increase, this is another reason why it’s not appropriate for you to go to see the ascetic Gotama.

original: Samaṇo tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaṁ kūṭadantaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ tu eva gotamaḥ arahati bhavantam kūṭadantam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: The ascetic Gotama should come to see you.

original: Bhavañhi kūṭadanto ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.🔽Yampi bhavaṁ kūṭadanto ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā
analyzed: bhavan hi kūṭadantaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena  yam pi kūṭa dantaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā
translated: For Master Kūṭadanta is well-born on both his mother’s and his father’s side, of pure descent to the seventh generation, unbroken, of irreproachable birth, and he has been declared by the brahmin Pokkharasati to be the most excellent of all the brahmins in Kosala in regard to wealth, in regard to beauty, in regard to wisdom.

original: pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena, imināpaṅgena na arahati bhavaṁ kūṭadanto🔽samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena iminā apaṅgena na arahati bhavam kūṭa dantaḥ  samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: Since Master Kūṭadanta is well-born on both his mother’s and his father’s side, of pure descent to the seventh generation, unbroken, of irreproachable birth, and he has been declared by the brahmin Pokkharasati to be the most excellent of all the brahmins in Kosala in regard to wealth, in regard to beauty, in regard to wisdom, for this reason too it is not proper that he should visit the recluse Gotama, but rather the recluse Gotama should visit him.

original: Samaṇo tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaṁ kūṭadantaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.🔽Bhavañhi kūṭadanto aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo pahūtavittūpakaraṇo pahūtajātarūparajato …pe…🔽Bhavañhi kūṭadanto ajjhāyako mantadharo tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ
analyzed: samaṇaḥ tu eva gotamaḥ arahati bhavantam kūṭadantam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu  bhavan hi kūṭa dantaḥ aḍḍhaḥ mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogo pahūta vittu upakaraṇo pahūta jātarūpa rajato  bhavan hi kūṭadantaḥ ajjhāyakaḥ manta dharaḥ tiṇṇam vedānam pāragū sa nighaṇḍu keṭubhāna
translated: The recluse Gotama should visit Master Kūṭadanta.🔽For Master Kūṭadanta is rich, with great wealth and great possessions, with an abundance of money, abundance of gold, abundance of riches, abundance of goods, abundance of silver, abundance of grain, abundance of cattle, abundance of sheep, abundance of elephants, horses, and chariots, abundance of bondservants, employees, and bearers, abundance of gold coins and cowries.

original: sākkharappabhedānaṁ itihāsapañcamānaṁ padako veyyākaraṇo lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo …pe…
analyzed: itihāsa pañcamānam padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ lokāyata mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu anavayaḥ pe
translated: Master Kūṭadanta is a master of the Three Vedas with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and etymology, and the histories as a fifth; skilled in philology and grammar, he is fully versed in natural philosophy and in the marks of a Great Man.

original: Bhavañhi kūṭadanto abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato brahmavaṇṇī brahmavacchasī akhuddāvakāso dassanāya …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi kūṭa dantaḥ abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇa pokkharatāya samannāgataḥ brahma vaṇṇī brahma vacchasī a khudda avakāsaḥ dassanāya pe
translated: You are handsome, good-looking, graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion, with skin the colour of gold, with a face like the bright moon, with a body that is well-developed,

original: Bhavañhi kūṭadanto sīlavā vuddhasīlī vuddhasīlena samannāgato …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi kūṭadanto sīlavā vuddha sīlī vuddha sīlena samannāgato pe
translated: You are virtuous, of good character,

original: Bhavañhi kūṭadanto kalyāṇavāco kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi kūṭa danto kalyāṇa vācaḥ kalyāṇa vāc karaṇo poriyāḥ vācāya samannāgataḥ vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā pe
translated: You are a good speaker, with a good voice, pleasant, articulate, and expressive,

original: Bhavañhi kūṭadanto bahūnaṁ ācariyapācariyo tīṇi māṇavakasatāni mante vāceti, bahū
analyzed: bhavan hi kūṭa dantaḥ tīṇi māṇavaka satāni mante vācā iti bahū
translated: You are a teacher of teachers, teaching three hundred youths to recite the mantras.

original: kho pana nānādisā nānājanapadā māṇavakā āgacchanti bhoto kūṭadantassa santike mantatthikā
analyzed: kho pana nānādisāḥ nānā janapadāḥ māṇavakāḥ āgacchanti bhoto kūṭadantassa santike mantatthikā
translated: Many youths come from various countries to learn the mantras from you.

original: mante adhiyitukāmā …pe…
analyzed: mante adhiyitu kāmā pe
translated: They want to learn the mantras from you.

original: Bhavañhi kūṭadanto jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto.
analyzed: bhavan hi kūṭadantaḥ jiṇṇaḥ vuddhaḥ mahallakaḥ addha gataḥ vayaḥ anuppatto
translated: You are old, aged, advanced in years, and have reached the final stage of life.🔽The Buddha is young, a youth, a young man, a young bhikṣu who has recently gone forth.

original: Samaṇo gotamo taruṇo ceva taruṇapabbajito ca …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamo taruṇaḥ ca iva taruṇa pabbajito ca pe
translated: The recluse Gotama is young in age and young since his going forth …

original: Bhavañhi kūṭadanto rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…🔽Bhavañhi kūṭadanto brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: bhavan hi kūṭadantaḥ raññaḥ māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe  bhavañhi kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: “Master Kūṭadanta is honored, respected, revered, and venerated by King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha …🔽by the brahmin Pokkharasāti …

original: Bhavañhi kūṭadanto khāṇumataṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: bhavan hi kūṭadantaḥ khāṇumatam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhaññam rāja bhoggam raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnam rāja dāyam brahmadeyya
translated: “Master Kūṭadanta lives in Khāṇumata, a populous place, full of grass and timber, close to the Ganges, with plenty of food and frequented by boats.

original: Yampi bhavaṁ kūṭadanto khāṇumataṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ
analyzed: yam pi bhavam kūṭadantaḥ khāṇumatam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhañña
translated: And Master Kūṭadanta lives in Khāṇumata, a populous place, full of grass and timber, close to the Ganges, with plenty of food and frequented by boats,

original: rājabhoggaṁ, raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ,
analyzed: rājabhogga raññā māgadhena seniyena bimbisārena dinnam rāja dāyam brahmadeyya
translated: which was given to him by King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha as a royal gift, a brahminical fee.

original: imināpaṅgena na arahati bhavaṁ kūṭadanto samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: iminā apaṅgena na arahati bhavam kūṭa dantaḥ samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: Because of this, too, Master Kūṭadanta is not fit to visit the recluse Gotama,

original: Samaṇo tveva gotamo arahati bhavantaṁ kūṭadantaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamitun”ti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ tu eva gotamaḥ arahati bhavantam kūṭadantam dassanāya upasaṅkamitun ti
translated: but rather the recluse Gotama is fit to visit Master Kūṭadanta.”🔽“Master Kūṭadanta, the recluse Gotama has arrived in Khāṇumata and is living in Makhadeva’s Mango Grove to the north of Khāṇumata.

original: 3. Buddhaguṇakathā
analyzed: buddha guṇa kathā
translated: 3. The Buddha’s qualities

original: Evaṁ vutte, kūṭadanto brāhmaṇo te brāhmaṇe etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ te brāhmaṇe etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Kūṭadanta said to those brahmins,

original: “Tena hi, bho, mamapi suṇātha, yathā mayameva arahāma taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ,
analyzed: tena hi bho mama api suṇātha yathā mayam eva arahāma tam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: “Well then, sirs, listen to why it is fitting for us to go to see the recluse Gotama,

original: na tveva arahati so bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.
analyzed: na tu eva arahati saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena
translated: and why it is not fitting for him to come to see us.🔽The recluse Gotama is well born on both sides, of pure maternal and paternal descent seven generations back, unassailable and impeccable in respect of birth.

original: Yampi, bho, samaṇo gotamo ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva🔽sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena, imināpaṅgena na arahati so
analyzed: yam pi bho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva  sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena iminā apaṅgena na arahati so
translated: Since the recluse Gotama is well born on both sides…

original: bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: this is a quality because of which it is not fitting for the reverend Gotama to come to see us.

original: Atha kho mayameva arahāma taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: atha kho mayam eva arahāma tam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: Rather, it is fitting for us to go to see him.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo mahantaṁ ñātisaṅghaṁ ohāya pabbajito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ mahantam ñāti saṅghaṃ ohāya pabbajitaḥ pe
translated: He has gone forth from the home life into homelessness, abandoning a large family circle.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo pahūtaṁ hiraññasuvaṇṇaṁ ohāya pabbajito bhūmigatañca vehāsaṭṭhaṁ ca …pe…🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo daharova samāno yuvā susukāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ pahūtam hirañña suvaṇṇam ohāya pabbajitaḥ bhūmi gatam ca vehāsaṭṭham ca pe  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ daharaḥ uva samānaḥ yuvā susu kāḷa kesaḥ bhadrena yobbanena samannāgataḥ paṭhamena vayasā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ pe
translated: He has gone forth from the home life into homelessness, abandoning much gold and bullion stored away in vaults and lofts.🔽He has gone forth from the home life into homelessness while still a youth, a black-haired young man endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, though his parents wished otherwise and wept with tearful faces.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo akāmakānaṁ mātāpitūnaṁ assumukhānaṁ rudantānaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ akāmakānam mātā pitūnam assu mukhānam rudantānam kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ pe
translated: He has gone forth from the home life into homelessness while still a youth, a black-haired young man endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, shaving off his hair and beard, clothing himself in the ocher robes, and going forth from the home life into homelessness, though his parents wished otherwise and wept with tearful faces.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato brahmavaṇṇī brahmavacchasī akhuddāvakāso dassanāya …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ pāsādikaḥ paramāya vaṇṇa pokkharatāya samannāgataḥ brahma vaṇṇī brahma vacchasī a khudda avakāsaḥ dassanāya pe
translated: He is handsome, comely, and graceful, possessing supreme beauty of complexion, with sublime beauty and sublime presence, remarkable to behold.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sīlavā ariyasīlī kusalasīlī kusalasīlena samannāgato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sīlavā ariya sīlī kusala sīlī kusala sīlena samannāgato pe
translated: He is virtuous, of increasing virtue, endowed with increasing virtue.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo kalyāṇavāco kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ kalyāṇa vācaḥ kalyāṇa vāc karaṇaḥ poriyāḥ vācāya samannāgataḥ vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā pe
translated: He is a good speaker with a good voice, one who can express himself and make himself understood.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo bahūnaṁ ācariyapācariyo …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ bahūnam ācariya pācariyaḥ pe
translated: He is a teacher of teachers.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo khīṇakāmarāgo vigatacāpallo …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ khīṇa kāma rāgaḥ vigata cāpallaḥ pe
translated: He has destroyed the taints.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo kammavādī kiriyavādī apāpapurekkhāro brahmaññāya pajāya …pe…🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo uccā kulā pabbajito asambhinnakhattiyakulā …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ kamma vādī kiriya vādī apāpa purekkhāraḥ brahmaññāya pajāya pe  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ uccā kulā pabbajitaḥ asambhinna khattiya kulā pe
translated: He advocates deeds and observances.🔽He went forth from an aristocratic family, from the Sakyans.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo aḍḍhā kulā pabbajito mahaddhanā mahābhogā …pe…🔽Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ tiroraṭṭhā tirojanapadā pañhaṁ pucchituṁ āgacchanti …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ aḍḍhā kulā pabbajitaḥ mahat dhanā mahā bhogā pe  samaṇam khalu bho gotamam tiroraṭṭhā tirojanapadā pañham pucchitum āgacchanti pe
translated: He went forth from a rich family, from a very wealthy family.🔽People come from afar to ask him about the meaning.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ anekāni devatāsahassāni pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gatāni …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam anekāni devatā sahassāni pāṇehi saraṇam gatāni pe
translated: Many thousands of deities have gone for refuge for life to the Lord.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: ‘There is this good report about Master Gotama:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti …pe…
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati pe
translated: “That Blessed One is accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.” …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi samannāgato …pe…🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo ehisvāgatavādī sakhilo sammodako abbhākuṭiko uttānamukho pubbabhāsī …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇehi samannāgataḥ pe  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ ehisvāgata vādī sa khilaḥ sammodakaḥ abbhākuṭikaḥ uttāna mukhaḥ pubba bhāsī pe
translated: ‘Master Gotama possesses the thirty-two marks of a Great Man …🔽‘Master Gotama speaks in praise of the Triple Rolling of the Wheel of the Dhamma …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo catunnaṁ parisānaṁ sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ catunnam parisānam sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: ‘Master Gotama is honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed …

original: Samaṇe khalu, bho, gotame bahū devā ca manussā ca abhippasannā …pe…
analyzed: samaṇe khalu bho gotame bahū devā ca manussā ca abhippasannā pe
translated: ‘Many deities and human beings have great confidence in Master Gotama …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo yasmiṁ gāme vā nigame vā paṭivasati na tasmiṁ gāme vā nigame vā amanussā manusse viheṭhenti …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ yasmin gāme vā nigame vā paṭivasati na tasmin gāme vā nigame vā amanussāḥ manusse viheṭhenti pe
translated: ‘When Master Gotama is living in a village or town, that place is not afflicted by non-human beings …🔽‘

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo saṅghī gaṇī gaṇācariyo puthutitthakarānaṁ aggamakkhāyati,🔽yathā kho pana, bho, etesaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ yathā vā tathā vā yaso samudāgacchati,
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ saṅghī gaṇī gaṇa ācariyo puthu tittha karānam aggam akkhāyati  yathā khalu pana bho etesam samaṇa brāhmaṇānam yathā vā tathā vā yasaḥ samudāgacchati
translated: The ascetic Gotama is the leader of an order and a teacher of an order, and he is regarded as the best of all those who claim to be perfected ones.

original: na hevaṁ samaṇassa gotamassa yaso samudāgato.
analyzed: na ha ivam samaṇassa gotamassa yasaḥ samudāgataḥ
translated: But the ascetic Gotama’s fame is not due to such things.

original: Atha kho anuttarāya vijjācaraṇasampadāya samaṇassa gotamassa yaso samudāgato …pe…🔽Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gato …pe…
analyzed: atha kho anuttarāya vijjā caraṇa sampadāya samaṇassa gotamassa yaso samudāgato pe  samaṇam khalu bho gotamam rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ sa puttaḥ sa bhariyaḥ sa parisaḥ sāmaccaḥ pāṇehi saraṇam gataḥ pe
translated: It is because of his unsurpassed knowledge and conduct that the ascetic Gotama’s fame has spread.🔽King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha, with his son, his wife, and his court, has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ rājā pasenadi kosalo saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ sa puttaḥ sa bhariyaḥ sa parisaḥ sa amaccaḥ pāṇehi saraṇam gataḥ pe
translated: King Pasenadi of Kosala, with his son, his wife, and his court, has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

original: Samaṇaṁ khalu, bho, gotamaṁ brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco pāṇehi saraṇaṁ gato …pe…
analyzed: samaṇam khalu bho gotamam brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti sa puttaḥ sa bhariyaḥ sa parisaḥ sa amacco pāṇehi saraṇam gataḥ pe
translated: The brahmin Pokkharasāti, with his son, his wife, and his court, has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha.

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…🔽Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo rañño pasenadissa kosalassa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ raññaḥ māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe  samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ raññaḥ pasenadissa kosalassa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: The ascetic Gotama is honoured, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed by King Bimbisāra of Magadha …🔽by King Pasenadi of Kosala …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito …pe…
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa sakkataḥ garukataḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ apacitaḥ pe
translated: by the brahmin Pokkharasāti …

original: Samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo khāṇumataṁ anuppatto khāṇumate viharati ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ khāṇumatam an uppattaḥ khāṇumate viharati ambalaṭṭhikāya
translated: The ascetic Gotama has arrived at Khanumata and is staying in Ambalatthika.

original: Ye kho pana, bho, keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā amhākaṁ gāmakhettaṁ āgacchanti, atithī no te honti.
analyzed: ye kho pana bho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā amhākam gāma khettam āgacchanti atithī no te honti
translated: And any ascetics or brahmins who come to our villages and fields are our guests.

original: Atithī kho panamhehi sakkātabbā garukātabbā mānetabbā pūjetabbā apacetabbā.
analyzed: atithī kho pana amhehi sakkātabbā garukātabbā mānetabbā pūjetabbā apacetabbā
translated: And we regard it as a duty to show hospitality to our guests, to honour, respect, revere, and venerate them, and to provide them with material supports.

original: Yampi, bho, samaṇo gotamo khāṇumataṁ anuppatto khāṇumate viharati ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ, atithimhākaṁ samaṇo gotamo.
analyzed: yam pi bho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ khāṇumatam an uppattaḥ khāṇumate viharati ambalaṭṭhikāya atithimhākam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ
translated: Since the ascetic Gotama has come to Khanumata and is staying in Ambalatthika, he is our guest.

original: Atithi kho panamhehi sakkātabbo garukātabbo mānetabbo pūjetabbo apacetabbo.
analyzed: atithi kho pana mhehi sakkātabbaḥ garukātabbaḥ mānetabbaḥ pūjetabbaḥ apacetabbaḥ
translated: A guest should be honored, respected, revered, venerated, and given precedence over us.

original: Imināpaṅgena nārahati so bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: iminā apaṅgena na arahati saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ amhākam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: On account of this, he is not worthy to come and see me.

original: Atha kho mayameva arahāma taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: atha kho mayam eva arahāma tam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: On the contrary, I am worthy to go and see him.

original: Ettake kho ahaṁ, bho, tassa bhoto gotamassa vaṇṇe pariyāpuṇāmi, no ca kho so bhavaṁ gotamo ettakavaṇṇo.
analyzed: ettake kho aha bho tassa bhotaḥ gotamassa vaṇṇe pariyāpuṇāmi no ca kho saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ ettaka vaṇṇaḥ
translated: I have learned this much praise of Master Gotama, but he is not praised only for this much.

original: Aparimāṇavaṇṇo hi so bhavaṁ gotamo”ti.
analyzed: aparimāṇa vaṇṇaḥ hi saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ iti
translated: Master Gotama is praised for immeasurable praise.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, te brāhmaṇā kūṭadantaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte te brāhmaṇāḥ kūṭadantam brāhmaṇam etat avocuḥ
translated: When this was said, the brahmins said to Kutadanta,

original: “yathā kho bhavaṁ kūṭadanto samaṇassa gotamassa vaṇṇe bhāsati, ito cepi so bhavaṁ gotamo yojanasate viharati, alameva saddhena kulaputtena dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ api puṭosenā”ti.
analyzed: yathā kho bhavam kūṭadantaḥ samaṇassa gotamassa vaṇṇe bhāsati ito ca ipi saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ yojana sate viharati alam eva saddhena kula puttena dassanāya upasaṅkamitum api puṭosena ati
translated: “Judging from how Master Kutadanta praises the recluse Gotama, it is enough for a faithful clansman to go and see him even if he lives a hundred leagues away.”

original: “Tena hi, bho, sabbeva mayaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bho sabbe iva mayam samaṇam gotamam dassanāya upasaṅkamissāma ati
translated: “Then, sirs, let us all go to see the recluse Gotama.”

original: 4. Mahāvijitarājayaññakathā
analyzed: mahā vijita rājayañña kathā
translated: 4. The Great Sacrifice of King Vijita

original: Atha kho kūṭadanto brāhmaṇo mahatā brāhmaṇagaṇena saddhiṁ yena ambalaṭṭhikā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ mahatā brāhmaṇa gaṇena saddhim yena ambalaṭṭhikā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the brahmin Kūṭadanta, together with a large group of brahmins, went to Ambalaṭṭhikā and approached the Blessed One.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Khāṇumatakāpi kho brāhmaṇagahapatikā appekacce bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ🔽nisīdiṁsu; appekacce bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi  khāṇumatakāḥ api kho brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ appa ekacce bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamanta  nisīdisu appekacce bhagavatā saddhim sammodisu sammodanīyam katham
translated: After approaching and exchanging pleasantries, he sat down to one side.🔽Some of the brahmin householders of Khāṇumata bowed down to the Blessed One and sat down to one side.🔽Some exchanged greetings with the Blessed One and sat down to one side.

original: vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā ekamantaṁ🔽nisīdiṁsu; appekacce nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu; appekacce tuṇhībhūtā
analyzed: vītisāretvā ekamantam appekacce yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā ekamanta  nisīdisu appa ekacce nāma gottam sāvetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appa ekacce tuṇhībhūtā
translated: Some extended their hands in reverential salutation towards the Blessed One and sat down to one side.🔽Some announced their name and clan to the Blessed One and sat down to one side.

original: ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: Some remained silent and sat down to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho kūṭadanto brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: eka mantam nisinnaḥ kho kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: While seated to one side, the brahmin Kūṭadanta said to the Blessed One:

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho gotama:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bho gotama
translated: “Master Gotama, I have heard that you say this:

original: ‘samaṇo gotamo tividhaṁ yaññasampadaṁ soḷasaparikkhāraṁ jānātī’ti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tividham yañña sampadam soḷasa parikkhāram jānāti iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama knows about the triple-knowledge and the sixteen aspects of the offering.’

original: Na kho panāhaṁ jānāmi tividhaṁ yaññasampadaṁ soḷasaparikkhāraṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana aham jānāmi tividham yañña sampadam soḷasa parikkhāra
translated: But I don’t know about the triple-knowledge and the sixteen aspects of the offering.

original: Icchāmi cāhaṁ mahāyaññaṁ yajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmi ca aham mahāyaññam yajitu
translated: I want to make a great sacrifice.

original: Sādhu me bhavaṁ gotamo tividhaṁ yaññasampadaṁ soḷasaparikkhāraṁ desetū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu me bhavam gotamaḥ tividham yañña sampadam soḷasa parikkhāram desetu uti
translated: It would be good if Master Gotama would teach me about the triple-knowledge and the sixteen aspects of the offering.”

original: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, suṇāhi sādhukaṁ manasikarohi, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi brāhmaṇa suṇāhi sādhukam manasikarohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay careful attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho kūṭadanto brāhmaṇo bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho kūṭadantaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavato paccassosi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Kūṭadanta replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “bhūtapubbaṁ, brāhmaṇa, rājā mahāvijito nāma ahosi aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo pahūtajātarūparajato pahūtavittūpakaraṇo pahūtadhanadhañño paripuṇṇakosakoṭṭhāgāro.
analyzed: bhūta pubba brāhmaṇa rājā mahāvijitaḥ nāma ahosi aḍḍhaḥ mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogo pahūta jātarūpa rajataḥ pahūta vittu upakaraṇaḥ pahūta dhana dhañño paripuṇṇa kosa koṭṭhāgāraḥ
translated: “Once upon a time, brahmin, there was a king named Mahāvijita who was rich, with great wealth and property, with an abundance of gold and silver, with an abundance of possessions and requisites, with an abundance of wealth and corn, with a full treasury and storehouses.

original: Atha kho, brāhmaṇa, rañño mahāvijitassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
analyzed: atha kho brāhmaṇa raññaḥ mahāvijitassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: Then, brahmin, while King Mahāvijita was reflecting in private, this train of thought arose in his mind:

original: ‘adhigatā kho me vipulā mānusakā bhogā, mahantaṁ pathavimaṇḍalaṁ abhivijiya ajjhāvasāmi, yannūnāhaṁ mahāyaññaṁ yajeyyaṁ, yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā’ti.
analyzed: adhigatā kho me vipulāḥ mānusakāḥ bhogāḥ mahantam pathavi maṇḍalam abhivijiya ajjhāvasāmi yat nūna aham mahāyaññam yajeyya yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: ‘I have gained great human wealth and rule over this great land after conquering it with my own arms. Let me now perform a great sacrifice, which will be for my benefit and happiness for a long time.’

original: Atha kho, brāhmaṇa, rājā mahāvijito purohitaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ āmantetvā etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu brāhmaṇa rājā mahāvijitaḥ purohitam brāhmaṇam āmantetvā etat avoca
translated: Then, brahmin, King Mahavijita summoned his priest, the brahmin minister, and told him what he had been thinking.

original: ‘idha mayhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
analyzed: idha brāhmaṇa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: ‘Here, brahmin, while I was alone in seclusion, this train of thought arose in my mind:

original: “adhigatā kho me vipulā mānusakā bhogā, mahantaṁ pathavimaṇḍalaṁ abhivijiya ajjhāvasāmi. Yannūnāhaṁ mahāyaññaṁ yajeyyaṁ yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
analyzed: adhigatā kho me vipulāḥ mānusakāḥ bhogāḥ mahantam pathavi maṇḍalam abhivijiya ajjhāvasāmi yat nūna aham mahāyaññam yajeyyam yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: “I have gained great human wealth and rule over this great land after conquering it with my own arms. Let me now perform a great sacrifice, which will be for my benefit and happiness for a long time.”

original: Icchāmahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, mahāyaññaṁ yajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaha brāhmaṇa mahāyaññam yajitu
translated: I wish to perform a great sacrifice.

original: Anusāsatu maṁ bhavaṁ yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā’ti.
analyzed: anusāsatu mam bhavam yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: Advise me, Master, on how this may be to my benefit and happiness for a long time.’

original: Evaṁ vutte, brāhmaṇa, purohito brāhmaṇo rājānaṁ mahāvijitaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte brāhmaṇa purohitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ rājānam mahāvijitam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the priest replied:

original: ‘bhoto kho rañño janapado sakaṇṭako sauppīḷo, gāmaghātāpi dissanti, nigamaghātāpi dissanti, nagaraghātāpi dissanti, panthaduhanāpi dissanti.
analyzed: bhoto kho raññaḥ janapado sa kaṇṭakaḥ sauppīḍaḥ gāma ghātā api dissanti nigama ghātā api dissanti nagara ghātā api dissanti panthaduhanā api dissanti
translated: ‘Your Majesty’s country is full of thieves, bandits, and murderers, and villages, towns, and cities are being destroyed.

original: Bhavaṁ kho pana rājā evaṁ sakaṇṭake janapade sauppīḷe balimuddhareyya, akiccakārī assa tena bhavaṁ rājā.
analyzed: bhavam kho pana rājā evam sa kaṇṭake janapade sauppīḷe balim uddhareyya akicca kārī assa tena bhavam rājā
translated: If Your Majesty were to collect taxes from such a country, Your Majesty would be doing wrong.

original: Siyā kho pana bhoto rañño evamassa:
analyzed: siyā kho pana bhoto rañño evam assa
translated: Your Majesty might think:

original: “ahametaṁ dassukhīlaṁ vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā samūhanissāmī”ti, na kho panetassa dassukhīlassa evaṁ sammā samugghāto hoti.
analyzed: aham etam dassu khīlam vadhena vā bandhena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā samūhanissāmi iti na kho pana etassa dassu khīlassa evam sammā samugghātaḥ hoti
translated: ‘I will get rid of this evil by execution, imprisonment, confiscation, condemnation, or banishment,’ but that evil will not be properly gotten rid of.

original: Ye te hatāvasesakā bhavissanti, te pacchā rañño janapadaṁ viheṭhessanti.
analyzed: ye te hata avasesakāḥ bhavissanti te pacchā raññaḥ janapadam viheṭhessanti
translated: Those who survive will later harm your country.

original: Api ca kho idaṁ saṁvidhānaṁ āgamma evametassa dassukhīlassa sammā samugghāto hoti.
analyzed: api ca kho idam sa vidhānam āgamma evam etassa dassu khīlassa sammā samugghātaḥ hoti
translated: But if you do this, this evil will be properly gotten rid of.

original: Tena hi bhavaṁ rājā ye bhoto rañño janapade ussahanti kasigorakkhe, tesaṁ bhavaṁ rājā bījabhattaṁ anuppadetu.🔽Ye bhoto rañño janapade ussahanti vāṇijjāya, tesaṁ bhavaṁ rājā pābhataṁ anuppadetu.
analyzed: tena hi bhavam rājā ye bhotaḥ raññaḥ janapade ussahanti kasi gorakkhe tesam bhavam rājā bīja bhattam anuppadetu  ye bhoto raññaḥ janapade ussahanti vāṇijjāya tesam bhavam rājā pābhatam anuppadetu
translated: ‘Well then, Your Majesty, please provide seed and grain for those in your realm who are able to work as farmers and as guards.🔽Please provide capital for those in your realm who are able to work as traders.

original: Ye bhoto rañño janapade ussahanti rājaporise, tesaṁ bhavaṁ rājā bhattavetanaṁ pakappetu.
analyzed: ye bhoto raññaḥ janapade ussahanti rāja porise tesam bhavam rājā bhatta vetanam pakappetu
translated: Please provide wages and salaries for those in your realm who work for the King.

original: Te ca manussā sakammapasutā rañño janapadaṁ na viheṭhessanti;
analyzed: te ca manussā sa kamma pasutā raññaḥ janapadam na viheṭhessanti
translated: Then those people, being occupied with their own work, will not harass the people of the King’s realm.

original: mahā ca rañño rāsiko bhavissati.
analyzed: mahā ca raññaḥ rāsikaḥ bhavissati
translated: And there will be great prosperity for the King’s realm.

original: Khemaṭṭhitā janapadā akaṇṭakā anuppīḷā. Manussā mudā modamānā ure putte naccentā apārutagharā maññe viharissantī’ti.
analyzed: khema ṭṭhitāḥ janapadāḥ akaṇṭakāḥ anuppīḷāḥ manussāḥ mudā modamānāḥ ure putte naccentāḥ a pāruta gharāḥ maññe viharissanti iti
translated: The country will be secure, free of violence and turmoil, and people will sleep with their doors wide open. They will enjoy themselves, sustained by their own merit.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, bho’ti kho, brāhmaṇa, rājā mahāvijito purohitassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā ye rañño janapade ussahiṁsu kasigorakkhe, tesaṁ rājā mahāvijito bījabhattaṁ anuppadāsi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho brāhmaṇa rājā mahāvijitaḥ purohitassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā ye raññaḥ janapade ussahisu kasi gorakkhe tesam rājā mahāvijitaḥ bīja bhattam anuppadāsi
translated: ‘Yes, sir,’ the King replied, and he did as requested.

original: Ye ca rañño janapade ussahiṁsu vāṇijjāya, tesaṁ rājā mahāvijito pābhataṁ anuppadāsi.
analyzed: ye ca raññaḥ janapade ussahisu vāṇijjāya tesam rājā mahāvijitaḥ
translated: And to those in the kingdom who were engaged in trade, King Mahāvijita gave the profits.

original: Ye ca rañño janapade ussahiṁsu rājaporise, tesaṁ rājā mahāvijito bhattavetanaṁ pakappesi.
analyzed: ye ca raññaḥ janapade ussahisu rāja porise tesam rājā mahāvijitaḥ bhatta vetanam pakappesi
translated: And to those in the kingdom who were engaged in service to the king, he gave wages and rations.

original: Te ca manussā sakammapasutā rañño janapadaṁ na viheṭhiṁsu, mahā ca rañño rāsiko ahosi.
analyzed: te ca manussā sa kamma pasutā raññaḥ janapadam na viheṭhisu mahā ca raññaḥ rāsikaḥ ahosi
translated: And those people, being occupied with their own work, did not harass the kingdom, and the king’s revenue increased.

original: Khemaṭṭhitā janapadā akaṇṭakā anuppīḷā manussā mudā modamānā ure putte naccentā apārutagharā maññe vihariṁsu.
analyzed: khema ṭṭhitāḥ janapadāḥ akaṇṭakāḥ anuppīḷāḥ manussāḥ mudā modamānāḥ ure putte naccentāḥ a pāruta gharāḥ maññe viharisu
translated: The country was well-ordered, free from violence and disorder, and the people of the town and countryside rejoiced, and were confident and happy, with no fear of danger. They slept peacefully and got up refreshed.

original: Atha kho, brāhmaṇa, rājā mahāvijito purohitaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ āmantetvā etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu brāhmaṇa rājā mahāvijitaḥ purohitam brāhmaṇam āmantetvā etat avoca
translated: Then King Mahāvijita addressed his priest, the brahmin Kūṭadanta, saying:

original: ‘samūhato kho me bhoto dassukhīlo, bhoto saṁvidhānaṁ āgamma mahā ca me rāsiko.
analyzed: samūhataḥ kho me bhoto dassukhīlaḥ bhoto sa vidhānam āgamma mahā ca me rāsiko
translated: ‘The gambling house has been closed, brahmin, and the king’s revenue has increased.

original: Khemaṭṭhitā janapadā akaṇṭakā anuppīḷā manussā mudā modamānā ure putte naccentā apārutagharā maññe viharanti.
analyzed: khema ṭṭhitāḥ janapadāḥ akaṇṭakāḥ anuppīḷāḥ manussāḥ mudā modamānāḥ ure putte naccentāḥ a pāruta gharāḥ maññe viharanti
translated: The country is well-ordered, free from violence and disorder, and the people of the town and countryside rejoice, and are confident and happy, with no fear of danger.

original: Icchāmahaṁ brāhmaṇa mahāyaññaṁ yajituṁ.
analyzed: icchāmaham brāhmaṇa mahāyaññam yajitu
translated: I want to hold a great sacrifice, brahmin.

original: Anusāsatu maṁ bhavaṁ yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā’ti.
analyzed: anusāsatu mam bhavam yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: Please advise me, Master, as to what would be for my lasting benefit and happiness.’

original: 4.1. Catuparikkhāra🔽Tena hi bhavaṁ rājā ye bhoto rañño janapade khattiyā ānuyantā negamā ceva jānapadā
analyzed: catu parikkhāra  tena hi bhavam rājā ye bhoto raññaḥ janapade khattiyāḥ ānuyantāḥ negamā ca iva jānapadā
translated: … the four requisites

original: ca te bhavaṁ rājā āmantayataṁ: ‘icchāmahaṁ, bho, mahāyaññaṁ yajituṁ, anujānantu me
analyzed: ca te bhavam rājā āmantayataḥ icchāmaha bho mahāyaññam yajitu anujānantu me
translated: ‘Well then, Master, tell the nobles in your king’s realm, both those who live in towns and those who live in the country,

original: bhavanto yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā’ti. Ye bhoto rañño janapade amaccā🔽pārisajjā negamā ceva jānapadā ca …pe… brāhmaṇamahāsālā negamā ceva jānapadā ca …pe…
analyzed: bhavantaḥ yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati ye bhotaḥ raññaḥ janapade amaccā  pārisajjāḥ negamāḥ ca iva jānapadāḥ ca pe brāhmaṇa mahāsālāḥ negamāḥ ca iva jānapadāḥ ca pe
translated: that you wish to perform a great sacrifice and ask them to allow you to do so, saying that it will be for your lasting benefit and happiness.🔽Tell the brahmins in your king’s realm, both those who live in towns and those who live in the country,

original: gahapatinecayikā negamā ceva jānapadā ca, te bhavaṁ rājā āmantayataṁ:
analyzed: gahapati necayikāḥ negamā ca iva jānapadā ca te bhavam rājā āmantayata
translated: and the wealthy brahmins and householders in your king’s realm, both those who live in towns and those who live in the country,

original: ‘icchāmahaṁ, bho, mahāyaññaṁ yajituṁ, anujānantu me bhavanto yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā’ti.
analyzed: icchāmaha bho mahāyaññam yajitu anujānantu me bhavantaḥ yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: that you wish to perform a great sacrifice and ask them to allow you to do so, saying that it will be for your lasting benefit and happiness.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, bho’ti kho, brāhmaṇa, rājā mahāvijito purohitassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā ye rañño janapade khattiyā ānuyantā negamā ceva jānapadā ca, te rājā mahāvijito āmantesi:🔽‘icchāmahaṁ, bho, mahāyaññaṁ yajituṁ, anujānantu me bhavanto yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā’ti.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho brāhmaṇa rājā mahāvijitaḥ purohitassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā ye raññaḥ janapade khattiyāḥ ānuyantāḥ negamāḥ ca iva jānapadāḥ ca te rājā mahāvijitaḥ āmantesi  icchāmaha bho mahāyaññam yajitu anujānantu me bhavantaḥ yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: ‘Yes, sir,’ the brahmin replied. He then went to the king’s people, both town and country dwellers, and said:🔽‘Your Majesty wishes to perform a great sacrifice. Please give him permission.’

original: ‘Yajataṁ bhavaṁ rājā yaññaṁ, yaññakālo, mahārājā’ti.
analyzed: yajatam bhavam rājā yañña yañña kālaḥ mahā rāja ati
translated: ‘Let the King perform the sacrifice, Your Honour. The time has come for the sacrifice.’

original: Ye rañño janapade amaccā pārisajjā negamā ceva jānapadā ca …pe… brāhmaṇamahāsālā negamā ceva jānapadā ca …pe… gahapatinecayikā negamā ceva jānapadā ca, te rājā mahāvijito āmantesi:🔽‘icchāmahaṁ, bho, mahāyaññaṁ yajituṁ. Anujānantu me bhavanto yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā’ti.
analyzed: ye raññaḥ janapade amaccā pārisajjā negamā ca iva jānapadā ca pe brāhmaṇa mahāsālā negamā ca iva jānapadā ca pe gahapati necayikā negamā ca iva jānapadā ca te rājā mahāvijitaḥ āmantesi  icchāmaha bho mahāyaññam yajitu anujānantu me bhavantaḥ yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: He then went to the king’s ministers and counsellors, both town and country dwellers, to the brahmins and householders, the wealthy and the heads of houses, both town and country dwellers, and said:🔽‘Your Majesty wishes to perform a great sacrifice. Please give him permission.’

original: ‘Yajataṁ bhavaṁ rājā yaññaṁ, yaññakālo, mahārājā’ti.
analyzed: yajatam bhavam rājā yañña yañña kālaḥ mahā rāja ati

analyzed: rājā mahāvijitaḥ aṭṭha haṅgehi samannāgato

analyzed: aḍḍhaḥ mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogo pahūta jātarūpa rajato pahūta vittu upakaraṇo pahūta dhana dhañño paripuṇṇa kosa koṭṭhāgāro
translated: he was wealthy, with great wealth, great possessions, great wealth and property, great riches and grain, great abundance of gold, silver, and money, and great storehouses filled with all kinds of goods;

analyzed: balavā caturaṅginiyā senāya samannāgataḥ assavāya ovāda paṭikarāya sahati maññe paccatthike yasasā

original: saddho dāyako dānapati anāvaṭadvāro samaṇabrāhmaṇakapaṇaddhikavaṇibbakayācakānaṁ opānabhūto puññāni karoti;
analyzed: saddhaḥ dāyakaḥ dānapati anāvaṭa dvāraḥ samaṇa brāhmaṇaka paṇaddhika vaṇibbaka yācakānaṃ opāna bhūto puññāni karoti
translated: he was a believer, a donor, a patron of ascetics and brahmins, one who makes offerings and performs meritorious deeds, with doors open to ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, and the beggars;

original: bahussuto tassa tassa sutajātassa, tassa tasseva kho pana bhāsitassa atthaṁ jānāti:
analyzed: bahu sutaḥ tassa tassa suta jātassa tassa tassa iva kho pana bhāsitassa attham jānāti
translated: He is learned, remembers what he has learned, and has the attitude that what he has learned is well grasped:

original: ‘ayaṁ imassa bhāsitassa attho ayaṁ imassa bhāsitassa attho’ti;
analyzed: ayam imassa bhāsitassa atthaḥ ayam imassa bhāsitassa atthaḥ ti
translated: ‘This is the meaning of this, and that is the meaning of that.’

analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī paṭibalaḥ atīta anāgata paccuppanne atthe cintetu
translated: He is wise, competent, intelligent, and capable of recollecting and retaining what he has learned.

original: Rājā mahāvijito imehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato.
analyzed: rājā mahāvijitaḥ imehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgato
translated: King Mahāvijita is endowed with these eight factors.

original: Iti imānipi aṭṭhaṅgāni tasseva yaññassa parikkhārā bhavanti.
analyzed: iti imāni api aṭṭhaṅgāni tassa iva yaññassa parikkhārāḥ bhavanti
translated: Thus these eight factors are the requisites for that sacrifice.

original: 4.3. Catuparikkhāra
analyzed: catu parikkhāra
translated: .. Four Requisites

original: Purohito brāhmaṇo catūhaṅgehi samannāgato,
analyzed: purohitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ catūhaṅgehi samannāgataḥ
translated: The brahmin chaplain is endowed with four factors,

original: ubhato sujāto mātito ca pitito ca saṁsuddhagahaṇiko yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena;
analyzed: ubhatas su jātaḥ mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena
translated: he is well-born on both his mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent to the seventh generation, unbroken lineage, impugnable on grounds of birth,

original: ajjhāyako mantadharo tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ sākkharappabhedānaṁ itihāsapañcamānaṁ padako veyyākaraṇo lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo;

translated: he has mastered the Three Vedas with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and etymology, and the testament as fifth; he has covered the subject matter thoroughly, and is well-versed in the philology and grammar of the verses and in the natural sciences, as well as in the marks of a Great Man.

original: sīlavā vuddhasīlī vuddhasīlena samannāgato;
analyzed: sīlavā vuddha sīlī vuddha sīlena samannāgato
translated: He is virtuous, of good character, and has fulfilled the precepts.

original: paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī paṭhamo vā dutiyo vā sujaṁ paggaṇhantānaṁ.
analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī paṭhamaḥ vā dutiyaḥ vā sujam
translated: He is wise, knowledgeable, and discerning, and is the first or second to hold the sacrificial ladle.

original: Purohito brāhmaṇo imehi catūhaṅgehi samannāgato.
analyzed: purohitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ imehi catūhaṅgehi samannāgataḥ
translated: The brahmin high priest has these four qualities.

original: Iti imānipi cattāri aṅgāni tasseva yaññassa parikkhārā bhavanti.
analyzed: iti imāni api cattāri aṅgāni tassa iva yaññassa parikkhārāḥ bhavanti
translated: These are the four requisites for the sacrifice.

original: 4.4. Tissovidhā
analyzed: tissovidhā

analyzed: atha kho brāhmaṇa purohitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ raññaḥ mahāvijitassa pubbā iva yaññā tissaḥ vidhāḥ desesi
translated: Before the sacrifice, the brahmin high priest teaches the king the threefold preparation.

original: Siyā kho pana bhoto rañño mahāyaññaṁ yiṭṭhukāmassa kocideva vippaṭisāro:
analyzed: siyā kho pana bhoto raññaḥ mahā yaññam yiṭṭhu kāmassa kocid eva vippaṭisāraḥ
translated: If the king is going to give a great sacrifice, he might feel regret, thinking:

analyzed: mahā vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchissati iti so bhotā raññā vippaṭisāraḥ na karaṇīyaḥ
translated: ‘I will lose a great deal of wealth.’ The king should not feel that regret.

original: Siyā kho pana bhoto rañño mahāyaññaṁ yajamānassa kocideva vippaṭisāro:
analyzed: siyā kho pana bhoto raññaḥ mahāyaññam yajamānassa kocid eva vippaṭisāraḥ
translated: If, while the king is giving the great sacrifice, he feels regret, thinking:

original: “mahā vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchatī”ti, so bhotā raññā vippaṭisāro na karaṇīyo.
analyzed: mahā vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchati iti saḥ bhotā raññā vippaṭisāraḥ na karaṇīyaḥ
translated: ‘I am losing a great deal of wealth,’ the king should not feel that regret.

original: Siyā kho pana bhoto rañño mahāyaññaṁ yiṭṭhassa kocideva vippaṭisāro:
analyzed: siyā kho pana bhoto raññaḥ mahā yaññam yiṭṭhassa kocid eva vippaṭisāraḥ
translated: Your Majesty might feel remorse after giving this great sacrifice,

analyzed: mahā vata me bhogakkhandho vigataḥ ti so bhotā raññā vippaṭisāraḥ na karaṇīyaḥ ti
translated: thinking: ‘I have lost a great deal of wealth.’ Your Majesty should not feel that remorse.”

original: Imā kho, brāhmaṇa, purohito brāhmaṇo rañño mahāvijitassa pubbeva yaññā tisso vidhā desesi.🔽4.5. Dasaākāra
analyzed: imā kho brāhmaṇa purohitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ raññaḥ mahāvijitassa pubbā iva yaññā tissaḥ vidhāḥ desesi  dasa ākāra
translated: This, Brahmin, was the first part of the sacrifice that the Brahmin chaplain had the King perform before the sacrifice.🔽.. ten aspects

original: Atha kho, brāhmaṇa, purohito brāhmaṇo rañño mahāvijitassa pubbeva yaññā dasahākārehi paṭiggāhakesu vippaṭisāraṁ paṭivinesi.
analyzed: atha kho brāhmaṇa purohitaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ raññaḥ mahāvijitassa pubbā iva yaññā dasa hākārehi paṭiggāhakesu vippaṭisāram paṭivinesi
translated: Then the Brahmin chaplain removed the King’s remorse in ten aspects:

original: ‘Āgamissanti kho bhoto yaññaṁ pāṇātipātinopi pāṇātipātā paṭiviratāpi.
analyzed: āgamissanti kho bhoto yaññam pāṇa atipātinaḥ api pāṇa atipātā paṭiviratā api
translated: ‘People who kill living creatures and those who abstain from killing living creatures will come to your sacrifice.

original: Ye tattha pāṇātipātino, tesaññeva tena.🔽Ye tattha pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā, te ārabbha yajataṁ bhavaṁ, sajjataṁ bhavaṁ, modataṁ bhavaṁ, cittameva bhavaṁ antaraṁ pasādetu.
analyzed: ye tattha pāṇa atipātino tesaññeva tena  ye tattha pāṇa atipātā paṭiviratā te ārabbha yajatam bhava sajjatam bhava modatam bhava cittam eva bhavam antaram pasādetu
translated: Those who kill living creatures will get the consequences of that,🔽but you should sacrifice, make merit, and rejoice for the sake of those who abstain from killing living creatures.

analyzed: āgamissanti kho bhoto yaññam a dinna ādāyinaḥ api a dinna ādānā paṭiviratā api pe
translated: People who take what is not given and those who abstain from taking what is not given …

analyzed: kāmesu micchācārinaḥ api kāmesu micchācārā paṭiviratā api
translated: those who are not celibate and those who are celibate …

translated: those who lie and those who don’t lie …🔽those who speak divisively and those who don’t speak divisively …🔽those who speak harshly and those who don’t speak harshly …

original: samphappalāpinopi samphappalāpā paṭiviratāpi …🔽abhijjhālunopi anabhijjhālunopi …
analyzed: samphappalāpinaḥ api samphappalāpā paṭiviratā api  abhijjhāluno pi an abhijjhāluno pi
translated: those who talk nonsense and those who don’t talk nonsense …🔽those who are covetous and those who are not covetous …

original: byāpannacittāpi abyāpannacittāpi …
analyzed: byāpanna cittā api a byāpanna cittā api
translated: those who have ill will and those who are without ill will …

original: micchādiṭṭhikāpi sammādiṭṭhikāpi ….
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhikā api sammādiṭṭhikā api
translated: those who have wrong view and those who have right view.

original: Ye tattha micchādiṭṭhikā, tesaññeva tena.
analyzed: ye tattha micchādiṭṭhikā tesaññeva tena
translated: Those who have wrong view will reap the result of that.

translated: But those who have right view, for their sake you should sacrifice, make offerings, and be devoted to giving. You should be gladdened and filled with joy in your heart.’

original: Imehi kho, brāhmaṇa, purohito brāhmaṇo rañño mahāvijitassa pubbeva yaññā dasahākārehi paṭiggāhakesu vippaṭisāraṁ paṭivinesi.

translated: Sixteen aspects

translated: Then the chaplain inspired King Mahāvijita’s mind with confidence in sixteen ways:

analyzed: rājā kho mahāvijitaḥ mahāyaññam yajati no ca kho tassa āmantitā amaccā pārisajjā

analyzed: negamā ca iva jānapadā ca pe brāhmaṇa mahāsālā negamā ca iva jānapadā ca pe gahapati necayikā
